programme.title: FBI

FBI: Special Crime Unit
programme.desc:
FBI: Created by Craig Turk, Dick Wolf. With Missy Peregrym, Zeeko Zaki, Jeremy Sisto, Ebonee Noel. Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Johnny_West"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anti-American Leftist Propaganda","reviewBody":"Horrible show that depicts the FBI as corrupt and incompetent, and every criminal is a victim of the USA and American culture. I never imagined that any show about the FBI could be so hateful against the United States.

The assistant Chief of the New York division, played by the lame Jeremy Sisto, spends his time trying to overturn convictions because he spent ten years in the FBI blacking out due to alcoholism, and sleeping with his subordinate, who covered for his mis-deeds. That is the new FBI.

In almost every episode, the FBI agents discuss the criminals, murderers, terrorists, etc., as being the victims of U. S. society, American values, white America, etc. Every story throws new shade on the FBI and/or the USA as a nation, or American culture.

I have never seen any of the FBI agents say, "Wow that guy was just plain evil," unless it was a white Anglo who was (always) a racist, Neo-Nazi, white supremacist, etc. The message of this show is that white people are evil, and everyone else, including the criminals, are victims of "White America." I am not white, and I find this show incredibly disturbing."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11503,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
NCIS: Los Angeles
Navy CIS
programme.desc: Created by Shane Brennan. With Chris O'Donnell, Daniela Ruah, Barrett Foa, LL Cool J. The Naval Criminal Investigation Service's Office of Special Projects takes on the undercover work and the hard to crack cases in LA. Key agents are G. Callen and Sam Hanna, streets kids risen through the ranks.

credits.actor: Mark Harmon, Sean Murray, Wilmer Valderrama, Emily Wickersham, Jack Fisher

drama","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5827228/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Ed-Shullivan","dateCreated":"2016-09-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"As Jack Nicholson once said......"You can't handle the truth!"","reviewBody":"Although the premise of Bull may have some merit, which is the story of a very good looking Dr. Jason Bull (starring Michael Weatherly) who owns a company named Trial Analysis Corporation, and whose life ambition is to be able to read people, including lawyers, judges, perpetrators but especially prospective jurors so that his clients will win their trials regardless if they are innocent or guilty, there is just a bit too much hocus pocus involved to pique my interest.

Like many other drama/crime series the writers tend to draw their audience down a certain emotional path and then in the last 10 minutes of the show (before the last set of another over extended commercial break) they not only show up with the star of the show and save the day by revealing how smart they are to the rest of the TV series cast, they end up showing how stupid they must think their audiences must be to spend the better part of an hour drama series filtering through an endless supply of TV commercials only to witness a very disappointing ending that you will so quickly forget that you won't even be able to repeat the dumb scenario to your friends at work the next day during lunch break. 

I will give this series the benefit of the doubt and I will watch a few more episodes in case the scripts improve, but I don't hold out much hope if I have to base my assessment on the pilot episode.

So far I give Bull ** out of **** stars.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15755,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7</script><metacontent="

drama","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5827228/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jonij-77617","dateCreated":"2016-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Trials, Philosophy, and Bad Guys, Oh my!!","reviewBody":"Don't listen to the Naysayers, and cynics on this review status. This TV show Bull is good, but like many others along this line, you have to remember it is just getting started. Just like any new product that has problems and kinks, they have to be fixed and then rolled out again. Also, trying to care and mend people is a very well difficult and tasking thing to do, but he does it with a bit of style, grace and oh, getting up in people's faces that deter him with a calm demeanor. Thus, with his experience, this is something he does to get a better scope or compass about them, trying to capture their character so he will know where to go next. I also like his crew, each one does a good job with all they need to do, and with a bit of spirited confidence and can-do attitude alongside of a small amount of humor and comedy. \n\nThe premise of this show is interesting, trying to get into the minds of people to see how they think and what moves them. This character Dr. Bull (Michael Weatherly) seems to care about these people, the defendant, the jury and everyone in between. He even takes the diamond in the rough, the little guy and even the underdog, and makes them become a little better than they were. Besides, I love how his character seems to take the problems that come before him with a cool and rational angle, even when he goes up against a bad guy. Together with his crew this drama, Bull, shows signs of definite potential. So give it a chance, even with its minor snags, you might just learn something about yourself.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15651,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7</script><metacontent="

Former professional hockey player Matt Shade partners with private eye Angie Everett to solve crimes around Toronto." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5722298/","name":"Private Eyes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBlNzUyZmQtOGU5MC00NTNlLWJlMjctMTQ0MGU0NTRkZmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQxOTY1OTk@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000594/","name":"Jason Priestley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1120797/","name":"Cindy Sampson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281284/","name":"Barry Flatman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0150938/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2850421/","name":"Tim Kilby","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0259275/","name":"Shelley Eriksen"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Private Eyes","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi576699417","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmYyZDgwYjYtYmU5Yy00NjdkLWIxZWMtNWMxMWUzZjZjYTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmYyZDgwYjYtYmU5Yy00NjdkLWIxZWMtNWMxMWUzZjZjYTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Private Eyes","datePublished":"2016-05-26","description":"Former professional hockey player Matt Shade partners with private eye Angie Everett to solve crimes around Toronto.","keywords":"hockey","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5722298/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nightc1","dateCreated":"2016-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally a pure P.I. show","reviewBody":"There have been a lot of detective shows through the years. Some lean to being campy comedy like Moonlighting, others end up a murder of the week procedural like Castle, and others like Veronica Mars end up being side jobs they do while doing other things. Granted I LOVE all of those shows but it's been a while since there has been a good P.I. show where the characters are both actual P.I.'s with random cases to solve. Veronica Mars came the closest.\n\nHere we have a more realistic side to the P.I. life. I really don't care for spoilers myself and I don't want to spoil the plot so what I really need to say is... if you've hungered for a pure P.I. show with random cases this is what you've been waiting for. It does, again, air a little more on the realistic side but without being dark. Like how it's not realistic for Magnum P.I. to be doing a stakeout in a Ferrari. Or how it's not realistic for a writer to be involved in every murder that goes through a precinct in Castle. Or how it's not realistic for a man to take the name Remington Steele so the female P.I. can solve cases that only the big boys get. So anyone that appreciates those kinds of little touches should, like me, find a lot to love with Private Eyes. It may start out seeming like it isn't going to live up to the claims I'm making but stick it out as it's definitely more than the first impression gives.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3787,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 5722298, Title: Private Eyes, --- Description: Private Eyes: Created by Tim Kilby, Shelley Eriksen. With Jason Priestley, Cindy Sampson, Barry Flatman, Jordyn Negri. Former professional hockey player Matt Shade partners with private eye Angie Everett to solve crimes around Toronto." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5722298/","name":"Private Eyes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBlNzUyZmQtOGU5MC00NTNlLWJlMjctMTQ0MGU0NTRkZmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQxOTY1OTk@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000594/","name":"Jason Priestley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1120797/","name":"Cindy Sampson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281284/","name":"Barry Flatman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0150938/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2850421/","name":"Tim Kilby","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0259275/","name":"Shelley Eriksen"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Private Eyes","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi576699417","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmYyZDgwYjYtYmU5Yy00NjdkLWIxZWMtNWMxMWUzZjZjYTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmYyZDgwYjYtYmU5Yy00NjdkLWIxZWMtNWMxMWUzZjZjYTUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Private Eyes","datePublished":"2016-05-26","description":"Former professional hockey player Matt Shade partners with private eye Angie Everett to solve crimes around Toronto.","keywords":"hockey","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5722298/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nightc1","dateCreated":"2016-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally a pure P.I. show","reviewBody":"There have been a lot of detective shows through the years. Some lean to being campy comedy like Moonlighting, others end up a murder of the week procedural like Castle, and others like Veronica Mars end up being side jobs they do while doing other things. Granted I LOVE all of those shows but it's been a while since there has been a good P.I. show where the characters are both actual P.I.'s with random cases to solve. Veronica Mars came the closest.\n\nHere we have a more realistic side to the P.I. life. I really don't care for spoilers myself and I don't want to spoil the plot so what I really need to say is... if you've hungered for a pure P.I. show with random cases this is what you've been waiting for. It does, again, air a little more on the realistic side but without being dark. Like how it's not realistic for Magnum P.I. to be doing a stakeout in a Ferrari. Or how it's not realistic for a writer to be involved in every murder that goes through a precinct in Castle. Or how it's not realistic for a man to take the name Remington Steele so the female P.I. can solve cases that only the big boys get. So anyone that appreciates those kinds of little touches should, like me, find a lot to love with Private Eyes. It may start out seeming like it isn't going to live up to the claims I'm making but stick it out as it's definitely more than the first impression gives.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3787,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4</script><metacontent="

drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Johnny_West"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anti-American Leftist Propaganda","reviewBody":"Horrible show that depicts the FBI as corrupt and incompetent, and every criminal is a victim of the USA and American culture. I never imagined that any show about the FBI could be so hateful against the United States.

The assistant Chief of the New York division, played by the lame Jeremy Sisto, spends his time trying to overturn convictions because he spent ten years in the FBI blacking out due to alcoholism, and sleeping with his subordinate, who covered for his mis-deeds. That is the new FBI.

In almost every episode, the FBI agents discuss the criminals, murderers, terrorists, etc., as being the victims of U. S. society, American values, white America, etc. Every story throws new shade on the FBI and/or the USA as a nation, or American culture.

I have never seen any of the FBI agents say, "Wow that guy was just plain evil," unless it was a white Anglo who was (always) a racist, Neo-Nazi, white supremacist, etc. The message of this show is that white people are evil, and everyone else, including the criminals, are victims of "White America." I am not white, and I find this show incredibly disturbing."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11503,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8}}</script><metacontent="

Leftist Propaganda","reviewBody":"Horrible show that depicts the FBI as corrupt and incompetent, and every criminal is a victim of the USA and American culture. I never imagined that any show about the FBI could be so hateful against the United States.

The assistant Chief of the New York division, played by the lame Jeremy Sisto, spends his time trying to overturn convictions because he spent ten years in the FBI blacking out due to alcoholism, and sleeping with his subordinate, who covered for his mis-deeds. That is the new FBI.

In almost every episode, the FBI agents discuss the criminals, murderers, terrorists, etc., as being the victims of U. S. society, American values, white America, etc. Every story throws new shade on the FBI and/or the USA as a nation, or American culture.

I have never seen any of the FBI agents say, "Wow that guy was just plain evil," unless it was a white Anglo who was (always) a racist, Neo-Nazi, white supremacist, etc. The message of this show is that white people are evil, and everyone else, including the criminals, are victims of "White America." I am not white, and I find this show incredibly disturbing.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11503,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8</script><metacontent="

picturesque village of Port Wenn in Cornwall.","keywords":"socially awkward man,doctor,opposites attract,fear of blood,rural setting","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0408381/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"groggo","dateCreated":"2007-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Brits Know How to Do It","reviewBody":"Doc Martin is so unusual and wonderfully off-kilter that it becomes addictive within 20 minutes of exposure. 

The titular Doc is a guy who was probably a curmudgeon before puberty. He's a surgeon from sophisticated, worldly London who moves to (fictional) Portwenn on the coast of Cornwall because he suddenly becomes ill at the sight of blood. This is not a good omen for a surgeon. He quits to become a general practitioner and he's satisfied, thanks very much, with checkups, prescriptions and referrals.

The foul-mannered, blunt-spoken Doc smugly considers himself above the crowd, but he soon learns he is really BELOW the crowd, out of step with Portwenn's eccentricities, value systems and peculiar burghers, who make the mere lunatics of London look normal by comparison.

Martin Clunes is terrific in the lead role. He is a tall, charismatic and not exactly handsome actor who looks like he would be more comfortable playing cops and heavies. He is, instead, a consummate comic actor. His facial and physical comedy, his frequent bouts of exasperation and bewilderment, are things to behold. (Note: some wags have compared him to 'House,' from the popular TV drama of the same name. House is played by Hugh Laurie, another splendid Brit, and that's about where the comparison begins and ends. They are two very different characters in two very different shows.)

Portwenn's local population, with its twisted logic that somehow makes perfect sense, is represented through the tour-de-force acting of supporting players: Bert (Ian McNeice, who always dazzles playing offbeat, world-weary philosophical characters); Louise (the charming and beautiful Caroline Catz), who either loves Martin or wants to kill him; corn-rowed Elaine (lovely Lucy Punch) as the ditzy assistant with her own set of secretarial ethics; and Doc's Aunt Joan (the great Stephanie Cole, who has been delighting audiences since the 1960s).

Dominic Minghella, he of the Minghella mob of talented artists (brother Anthony directed 'The English Patient'), is the brains behind this brilliant controlled chaos.

Don't miss this program. TV shows that are both funny AND intelligent are the rarest of TV fare.

And a fast footnote: let us all bow our heads and pray that Hollywood doesn't try to remake this.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13331,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3</script><metacontent="

8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2606414105","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU0NDQ5NTctYjJmOC00MmRjLWEwYzItYjNjYzllNTY2YWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU0NDQ5NTctYjJmOC00MmRjLWEwYzItYjNjYzllNTY2YWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Doc Martin: Season 8","datePublished":"2004-09-02","description":"The trials and tribulations of Dr. Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes), a socially challenged doctor who moves from London to the picturesque village of Port Wenn in Cornwall.","keywords":"socially awkward man,doctor,opposites attract,fear of blood,rural setting","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0408381/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"groggo","dateCreated":"2007-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Brits Know How to Do It","reviewBody":"Doc Martin is so unusual and wonderfully off-kilter that it becomes addictive within 20 minutes of exposure. 

The titular Doc is a guy who was probably a curmudgeon before puberty. He's a surgeon from sophisticated, worldly London who moves to (fictional) Portwenn on the coast of Cornwall because he suddenly becomes ill at the sight of blood. This is not a good omen for a surgeon. He quits to become a general practitioner and he's satisfied, thanks very much, with checkups, prescriptions and referrals.

The foul-mannered, blunt-spoken Doc smugly considers himself above the crowd, but he soon learns he is really BELOW the crowd, out of step with Portwenn's eccentricities, value systems and peculiar burghers, who make the mere lunatics of London look normal by comparison.

Martin Clunes is terrific in the lead role. He is a tall, charismatic and not exactly handsome actor who looks like he would be more comfortable playing cops and heavies. He is, instead, a consummate comic actor. His facial and physical comedy, his frequent bouts of exasperation and bewilderment, are things to behold. (Note: some wags have compared him to 'House,' from the popular TV drama of the same name. House is played by Hugh Laurie, another splendid Brit, and that's about where the comparison begins and ends. They are two very different characters in two very different shows.)

Portwenn's local population, with its twisted logic that somehow makes perfect sense, is represented through the tour-de-force acting of supporting players: Bert (Ian McNeice, who always dazzles playing offbeat, world-weary philosophical characters); Louise (the charming and beautiful Caroline Catz), who either loves Martin or wants to kill him; corn-rowed Elaine (lovely Lucy Punch) as the ditzy assistant with her own set of secretarial ethics; and Doc's Aunt Joan (the great Stephanie Cole, who has been delighting audiences since the 1960s).

Dominic Minghella, he of the Minghella mob of talented artists (brother Anthony directed 'The English Patient'), is the brains behind this brilliant controlled chaos.

Don't miss this program. TV shows that are both funny AND intelligent are the rarest of TV fare.

And a fast footnote: let us all bow our heads and pray that Hollywood doesn't try to remake this.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13331,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3</script><metacontent="

Too bad some people take it as propaganda, it's only a TV show...

I liked the pilot and it left a lot of room for character and storyline development. 

Seeing as there are far worst shows out there, I'm willing to give this one a chance and hope to be positively surprised. 

Also, I've been waiting for Téa Leoni to be back on TV and really enjoyed watching her in a role that is perfect for her.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20470,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6</script><metacontent="

Too bad some people take it as propaganda, it's only a TV show...

I liked the pilot and it left a lot of room for character and storyline development. 

Seeing as there are far worst shows out there, I'm willing to give this one a chance and hope to be positively surprised. 

Also, I've been waiting for Téa Leoni to be back on TV and really enjoyed watching her in a role that is perfect for her.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20470,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6</script><metacontent="

A mother daughter reunion set in the harsh reality of a women's correctional facility" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0258223/","name":"Stranger Inside","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4MjgyMDQxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTk2MTgxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0743931/","name":"Yolonda Ross"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0568672/","name":"Davenia McFadden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0681095/","name":"Rain Phoenix"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0243109/","name":"Cheryl Dunye"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116515/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053783/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189432/","name":"Catherine Crouch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0243109/","name":"Cheryl Dunye"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stranger Inside","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2156265753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ5MDgyZjMtNmYxYS00OGU2LWJkYTctODBiMmFkMjI4NDFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ5MDgyZjMtNmYxYS00OGU2LWJkYTctODBiMmFkMjI4NDFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from HBO Home Video"},"datePublished":"2001-06-23","description":"A mother daughter reunion set in the harsh reality of a women's correctional facility","keywords":"women in prison,reunion,mother daughter reunion,f rated,homosexual","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0258223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tcm0624"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's the ending that makes it.","reviewBody":"There are quite a few things wrong with this film. Let's see:

We don't like any character too much. The main character's quiet, yet aggressive, manner hinders the character development. The duality of love among prison "families" and prison violence is not totally believable. At times, the movie actually seems slow moving.

This movie is very similar to some other prison movie in every aspect except the ending.

I sure didn't expect the ending yet now it makes perfect sense. All by itself the ending makes the movie worth watching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":539,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

witch","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10361016/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sarahpenbridge"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"This is not Penny Dreadful","reviewBody":"If you came here looking for the grim, supernatural awesomeness of the original Penny Dreadful, then keep on moving. I don't know why this wasn't just sold as some 1950s gangster series. The cast is amazing, great visuals and acting, but there is almost nothing supernatural about this! Which was kind of the entire point of Penny Dreadful. Aside from some dramatic walk-ons in a gorgeous leather gown from Dormer, and some odd side characters she somehow also needs to play, the supernatural aspect is completely missing. There is SO much that could have been done with the story. Disappointed because I was a huge fan of the original PD!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8473,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6}}</script><metacontent="

I don't know why this wasn't just sold as some 1950s gangster series. The cast is amazing, great visuals and acting, but there is almost nothing supernatural about this! Which was kind of the entire point of Penny Dreadful. Aside from some dramatic walk-ons in a gorgeous leather gown from Dormer, and some odd side characters she somehow also needs to play, the supernatural aspect is completely missing. There is SO much that could have been done with the story. is not Penny Dreadful","reviewBody":"If you came here looking for the grim, supernatural awesomeness of the original Penny Dreadful, then keep on moving. I don't know why this wasn't just sold as some 1950s gangster series. The cast is amazing, great visuals and acting, but there is almost nothing supernatural about this! Which was kind of the entire point of Penny Dreadful. Aside from some dramatic walk-ons in a gorgeous leather gown from Dormer, and some odd side characters she somehow also needs to play, the supernatural aspect is completely missing. There is SO much that could have been done with the story. Disappointed because I was a huge fan of the original PD!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8473,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6</script><metacontent="

A political drama which looks into the life of the Secretary of State as she tries to balance work with family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3501074/","name":"Madam Secretary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWJiMTNiNDktZGM1ZS00NmU3LWFiNmQtNjc0ZjNlMTU5ZjAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004857/","name":"Tim Daly","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2706992/","name":"Erich Bergen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0111281/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075256/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0355329/","name":"Barbara Hall"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Madam Secretary: Series Premiere","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4153522201","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY2OWVmZDctNzBiYy00YjEyLWIxZjItZGNkM2I4YTlhODYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY2OWVmZDctNzBiYy00YjEyLWIxZjItZGNkM2I4YTlhODYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer","datePublished":"2014-09-21","description":"A political drama which looks into the life of the Secretary of State as she tries to balance work with family.","keywords":"politician,secretary of state,chief of staff,political conflict,politics","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3501074/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Kaliani","dateCreated":"2014-09-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Will wait and see","reviewBody":"Being from Europe and not really interested in the details of US politics, I watched the show simply as entertainment and did not take it too seriously. Too bad some people take it as propaganda, it's only a TV show...

I liked the pilot and it left a lot of room for character and storyline development. 

Seeing as there are far worst shows out there, I'm willing to give this one a chance and hope to be positively surprised. 

Also, I've been waiting for Téa Leoni to be back on TV and really enjoyed watching her in a role that is perfect for her.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20470,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 2980696, Title: Quarry, --- Description: Quarry: Created by Michael D. Fuller, Graham Gordy. With Logan Marshall-Green, Jodi Balfour, Damon Herriman, Edoardo Ballerini. Quarry, a disillusioned Vietnam War vet, returns home to Memphis in 1972 only to find rejection and scrutiny at every step. A mysterious man known only as The Broker gives him an offer he can't refuse - to work for him as a hitman." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2980696/","name":"Quarry","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM1OGQ1NjEtYzU1My00ZGY4LTg4NjQtN2JiNWIxYWEzMjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjIyMjI3NDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1334869/","name":"Logan Marshall-Green","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3341156/","name":"Jodi Balfour","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0380632/","name":"Damon Herriman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017525/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1331637/","name":"Michael D. Fuller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330704/","name":"Graham Gordy"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Quarry Season 1--Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1119663641","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ4NTkyODIyMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMyOTA5OTE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ4NTkyODIyMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMyOTA5OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"","datePublished":"2016-09-09","description":"Quarry, a disillusioned Vietnam War vet, returns home to Memphis in 1972 only to find rejection and scrutiny at every step. A mysterious man known only as The Broker gives him an offer he can't refuse - to work for him as a hitman.","keywords":"broker,military,blackmail,revenge,money","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2980696/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"slarabee-36-278471","dateCreated":"2016-09-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Writing, Acting and Production Quality","reviewBody":"I really enjoy Quarry so far. First two episodes have told a story nicely. Everything that the main character does makes sense (for a broken lost soul).

I highly recommend this show. It makes sense. I hope that as the deeper story unfolds, it maintains it's intelligent story telling.

The end of episode two left me worried about the course of the story, but I will just have to wait and see what happens like everyone else.

So far so good though. I rated this a ten and hope it lives up to the confidence I have in the writing.

Also hats off to the main characters acting. Top notch!! Logan Marshall-Green and Jodi Balfour are fantastic, but the cast is filled with great talent all giving the performances of their lives. No matter what I know they (and everyone else) will look back on their work in this series as some of their best.

Direction is seamless and the production moves along at a nice pace as well.

Again Top Notch best of the best TV... so far.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11758,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1</script><metacontent="

Set in a post-Jax Teller world, "Mayans MC" sees EZ Reyes, a former golden boy now fresh out of prison, as a prospect in the Mayan MC charter on the California-Mexico border who must carve out his new outlaw identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5715524/","name":"Mayans M.C.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDEyY2ZkMTgtOGE1YS00MWQ1LWJkNzQtMDBlMjBhZjJlNWViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1238555/","name":"JD Pardo","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6384710/","name":"Clayton Cardenas","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092961/","name":"Sarah Bolger"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216537/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0320887/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0511631/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1990437/","name":"Elgin James","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1176676/","name":"Kurt Sutter"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 2: Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi677493785","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM4NTBjZGQtMWU2NC00NmNkLTk3ZTItMDFkNGUxMzg3ZjU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM4NTBjZGQtMWU2NC00NmNkLTk3ZTItMDFkNGUxMzg3ZjU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Be part of the club. Watch the OFFICIAL TRAILER for the all-new season of Mayans M.C. Premieres 9/3 on FX.","datePublished":"2018-09-04","description":"Set in a post-Jax Teller world, "Mayans MC" sees EZ Reyes, a former golden boy now fresh out of prison, as a prospect in the Mayan MC charter on the California-Mexico border who must carve out his new outlaw identity.","keywords":"dystopia,motorcycle gang,biker gang,outlaw motorcycle gang,outlaw biker","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5715524/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kayjay-84356","dateCreated":"2018-10-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Did not expect to like this show as much as I do","reviewBody":"Pleasantly surprised with this new show. Loved SOA and expected this to be a lesser substitute, but it is not. Mayans has heart and a great plot. Egaging actors easy to identify/believe. Have to agree the only character who seems out of place is Emily. Hard to understand how the pure little drama queen became accepted by people grounded in the reality of their world. Good strong characters with great acting all around other than that. Every scene she appears in my brain asks "WHY?" She does not fit, personality, speech, appearance, everything is wrong for her in this show. Similar to having a stone in your shoe, Emily is an irritant to otherwise entertaining experience.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14033,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Downhill
Downhill
programme.desc:
Downhill: Directed by Nat Faxon, Jim Rash. With Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Will Ferrell, Zach Woods, Zoe Chao. Barely escaping an avalanche during a family ski vacation in the Alps, a married couple is thrown into disarray as they are forced to reevaluate their lives and how they feel about each other." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4558376/","name":"Downhill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2QxMWFlOTktNWY0Mi00MDQ5LWExMTYtNThjZTFhNGZkZjk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000506/","name":"Julia Louis-Dreyfus"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2046855/","name":"Zach Woods"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269542/","name":"Nat Faxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711110/","name":"Jim Rash"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0111265/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0190175/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0781820/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1104036/","name":"Jesse Armstrong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269542/","name":"Nat Faxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711110/","name":"Jim Rash"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi542883609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUyMTYzNWItNmIwMS00ZTVkLWJmZTgtZGQ3MzJhOWFhOWQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUyMTYzNWItNmIwMS00ZTVkLWJmZTgtZGQ3MzJhOWFhOWQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Things go off-piste for a married couple on a family vacation in the Alps. An avalanche leads to some drastic decisions with uncomfortable consequences. Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Will Ferrell star in this biting dark comedy. From writers and directors Nat Faxon and Jim Rash (The Way Way Back, writers of The Descendants) and written by Jessie Armstrong (Succession), Nat Faxon and Jim Rash."},"datePublished":"2020-02-14","description":"Barely escaping an avalanche during a family ski vacation in the Alps, a married couple is thrown into disarray as they are forced to reevaluate their lives and how they feel about each other.","keywords":"remake,snow,ski,vacation,married couple","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4558376/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jamuckley"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cringeworthy "Comedy" to Avoid","reviewBody":"Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Will Ferrell star in "Downhill," a new comedy that comes out on Valentine's Day, Friday 14, 2020. The film was directed by Nat Faxon and Jim Rash.

Billie (Louis-Dreyfus) and her two boys barely escape been buried alive during a "controlled" avalanche, while Pete (Ferrell) runs for cover thinking only about his self. The scary ordeal causes them to take a fresh look at their marriage and their future together.

I had high hopes with the pairing of Louis-Dreyfus and Ferrell and what kind of comedic caper on the ski slopes might ensue. Unfortunately, this film was disappointing. This isn't the kind of "feel-good" romantic movie to take your significant other out to see on Valentine's Day.

The film isn't mushy and doesn't "resolve" like a bow on a pretty package. Instead, it is more of a "warning" in relationships, showing how miscommunication, self-centeredness, defensiveness all can contribute to breaking down bonds in relationships. The humor in it is how the couple fails to address the issue directly causing further distance, bringing others into it to plead their case, and even puts the kids in the middle. There were some cringeworthy moments throughout.

Some of the film's less flattering moments include an awkward scene with a ski instructor, crude sexual humor, and drunkenness without any really point.

I would recommend steering clear of this one, in favor of a nice evening in, preparing dinner for your partner, snuggling up on the couch and dreaming together about your hopes for the future so you don't end up like Billie and Pete unsure of what is next in store for your relationship.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10546,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

when I was a child, I never actually cried during a movie. I've felt the urge to cry during some of them or had tears forming in my eyes, but they never really came out. Before I viewed "Awakenings," "Schindler's List" was the closest one to making me cry. Now, "Awakenings" has done it.

Another great thing about "Awakenings," is that it truly teaches us to appreciate the simple things in life that we take for granted, from taking a walk by yourself or reading a book or even just brushing your teeth.

I don't care what anyone says, both Robin Williams' and Robert DeNiro's performances were excellent and touching. I found this more touching then "Patch Adams." (But I guess "Patch Adams" is more of a Comedy/drama).

Give this great film a try. Grab the Kleenexs during Robert De Niro's first dance.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130087,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood
Once upon a time in Hollywood
programme.desc:
Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood: Directed by Quentin Tarantino. With Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Emile Hirsch. A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7131622/","name":"Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg4ZTNkZmUtMzNlZi00YmFjLTk1MmUtNWQwNTM0YjcyNTNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg2NjQwMDQ@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000138/","name":"Leonardo DiCaprio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000093/","name":"Brad Pitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3053338/","name":"Margot Robbie"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0452101/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159772/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch Now on STARZ","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1385741849","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTQxODQzMGUtZTA0ZS00Y2NlLTljZjAtYzNlNzUxZjBjZmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTQxODQzMGUtZTA0ZS00Y2NlLTljZjAtYzNlNzUxZjBjZmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2019-07-26","description":"A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles.","keywords":"place in title,violence,film within a film,manson murders,dog","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7131622/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Vic_max"},"dateCreated":"2019-07-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A meandering masterpiece ... I didn't want it to end","reviewBody":"This is such an unusual movie. It doesn't really have a plot ... it's kind of like a "day in the life of a fading Hollywood TV actor", but still it's just fascinating to watch. The acting, cinematography and production values for capturing the late 60s (and really ... dawn of the 70s) are about as good as you'll ever see. It's just art.

And when it comes the ending ... wow. Especially if you know a bit of history. It's intense and amazing and I'll just leave it at that.

That said, it is a little male-biased by modern standards, but it's capturing the mentality of a different time period. DiCaprio and Pitt play two wildly different characters that you just want to keep watching to see they do next. They will quite possibly win Oscars for their performances -- and Tarantino will no doubt be up for best director, best original screenplay and best film.

If you enjoy Tarantino's moviemaking style - the dialog, the visuals, the period details and, yes ... the violence ... this is a must see. It's almost 2 and 3/4 hours - but I would have gladly stayed longer.

BTW, if you stay a minute into the end-credits, there's a post credit scene followed by a fun radio (audio-only) contest commercial."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":596625,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT2H41M"}</script><metacontent="

And when it comes the ending ... wow. Especially if you know a bit of history. It's intense and amazing and I'll just leave it at that.

That said, it is a little male-biased by modern standards, but it's capturing the mentality of a different time period. DiCaprio and Pitt play two wildly different characters that you just want to keep watching to see they do next. They will quite possibly win Oscars for their performances -- and Tarantino will no doubt be up for best director, best original screenplay and best film.

If you enjoy Tarantino's moviemaking style - the dialog, the visuals, the period details and, yes ... the violence ... this is a must see. It's almost 2 and 3/4 hours - but I would have gladly stayed longer.

BTW, if you stay a minute into the end-credits, there's a post credit scene followed by a fun radio (audio-only) contest commercial.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":596625,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"duration":"PT2H41M"</script><metacontent="

Career May Never Recover","reviewBody":"I sincerely wish I could erase this film from my memory. I love Adam Sandler, and yes, he's had a couple of bad films but this one is so bad I believe his career might actually end because of it.

The constant shrieking of Jill is unbearable, and were we really meant to take Sandler's female character seriously? Or was this film only meant to be "funny" because Sandler's in drag? I've still not figured that out, and I don't think I'll devote much more time to doing so.

This film led me to create my IMDb account because if what I've said here can keep even one person from paying to see it then I feel it will have been worth writing.

programme.title: Downhill
Downhill
programme.desc:
Downhill: Directed by Nat Faxon, Jim Rash. With Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Will Ferrell, Zach Woods, Zoe Chao. Barely escaping an avalanche during a family ski vacation in the Alps, a married couple is thrown into disarray as they are forced to reevaluate their lives and how they feel about each other." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4558376/","name":"Downhill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2QxMWFlOTktNWY0Mi00MDQ5LWExMTYtNThjZTFhNGZkZjk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000506/","name":"Julia Louis-Dreyfus"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2046855/","name":"Zach Woods"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269542/","name":"Nat Faxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711110/","name":"Jim Rash"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0111265/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0190175/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0781820/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1104036/","name":"Jesse Armstrong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269542/","name":"Nat Faxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711110/","name":"Jim Rash"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi542883609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUyMTYzNWItNmIwMS00ZTVkLWJmZTgtZGQ3MzJhOWFhOWQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUyMTYzNWItNmIwMS00ZTVkLWJmZTgtZGQ3MzJhOWFhOWQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Things go off-piste for a married couple on a family vacation in the Alps. An avalanche leads to some drastic decisions with uncomfortable consequences. Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Will Ferrell star in this biting dark comedy. From writers and directors Nat Faxon and Jim Rash (The Way Way Back, writers of The Descendants) and written by Jessie Armstrong (Succession), Nat Faxon and Jim Rash."},"datePublished":"2020-02-14","description":"Barely escaping an avalanche during a family ski vacation in the Alps, a married couple is thrown into disarray as they are forced to reevaluate their lives and how they feel about each other.","keywords":"remake,snow,ski,vacation,married couple","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4558376/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jamuckley"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cringeworthy "Comedy" to Avoid","reviewBody":"Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Will Ferrell star in "Downhill," a new comedy that comes out on Valentine's Day, Friday 14, 2020. The film was directed by Nat Faxon and Jim Rash.

Billie (Louis-Dreyfus) and her two boys barely escape been buried alive during a "controlled" avalanche, while Pete (Ferrell) runs for cover thinking only about his self. The scary ordeal causes them to take a fresh look at their marriage and their future together.

I had high hopes with the pairing of Louis-Dreyfus and Ferrell and what kind of comedic caper on the ski slopes might ensue. Unfortunately, this film was disappointing. This isn't the kind of "feel-good" romantic movie to take your significant other out to see on Valentine's Day.

The film isn't mushy and doesn't "resolve" like a bow on a pretty package. Instead, it is more of a "warning" in relationships, showing how miscommunication, self-centeredness, defensiveness all can contribute to breaking down bonds in relationships. The humor in it is how the couple fails to address the issue directly causing further distance, bringing others into it to plead their case, and even puts the kids in the middle. There were some cringeworthy moments throughout.

Some of the film's less flattering moments include an awkward scene with a ski instructor, crude sexual humor, and drunkenness without any really point.

I would recommend steering clear of this one, in favor of a nice evening in, preparing dinner for your partner, snuggling up on the couch and dreaming together about your hopes for the future so you don't end up like Billie and Pete unsure of what is next in store for your relationship.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10546,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

female","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099077/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"poetic_dreams"},"dateCreated":"2003-09-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tearjerker","reviewBody":"Besides when I was a child, I never actually cried during a movie. I've felt the urge to cry during some of them or had tears forming in my eyes, but they never really came out. Before I viewed "Awakenings," "Schindler's List" was the closest one to making me cry. Now, "Awakenings" has done it.

Another great thing about "Awakenings," is that it truly teaches us to appreciate the simple things in life that we take for granted, from taking a walk by yourself or reading a book or even just brushing your teeth.

I don't care what anyone says, both Robin Williams' and Robert DeNiro's performances were excellent and touching. I found this more touching then "Patch Adams." (But I guess "Patch Adams" is more of a Comedy/drama).

Give this great film a try. Grab the Kleenexs during Robert De Niro's first dance.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130087,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

female","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099077/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"poetic_dreams","dateCreated":"2003-09-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tearjerker","reviewBody":"Besides when I was a child, I never actually cried during a movie. I've felt the urge to cry during some of them or had tears forming in my eyes, but they never really came out. Before I viewed "Awakenings," "Schindler's List" was the closest one to making me cry. Now, "Awakenings" has done it.

Another great thing about "Awakenings," is that it truly teaches us to appreciate the simple things in life that we take for granted, from taking a walk by yourself or reading a book or even just brushing your teeth.

I don't care what anyone says, both Robin Williams' and Robert DeNiro's performances were excellent and touching. I found this more touching then "Patch Adams." (But I guess "Patch Adams" is more of a Comedy/drama).

Give this great film a try. Grab the Kleenexs during Robert De Niro's first dance.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130087,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"duration":"PT2H1M"</script><metacontent="

Nazis.","keywords":"accountant,champagne,villa,womanizer,soap","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0108052/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ebiros2"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Awesome","reviewBody":"The movie started out pretty innocently, and for the first 20 minutes, I was wondering where the movie was going. Then it started to happen. The horrible cruelty of concentration camps. Oskar Schindler is an example of a man that no matter what the situation, there are people who won't go along with the cruelty of society. I'm sure it took courage to do what he did, because one wrong move and you'll be dead.

Movie brought to life this great man who really shouldn't be forgotten, and thanks to Steven Spielberg, I think he'll be remembered for generations to come. Movie like this should be made once in a while. Not that movie should be used for evangelistic purposes but some story should be told well, and movie is still the best vehicle to do so.

I still think that Oskar Shindler's last words in this movie was one of the best dialog in movie history - "Why did I keep this badge ? I could have saved a person. Why did I keep this car ?, I could have saved five more people."","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1241226,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.9},"duration":"PT3H15M"}</script><metacontent="

title","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0810913/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"prescottcandace"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sandler's Career May Never Recover","reviewBody":"I sincerely wish I could erase this film from my memory. I love Adam Sandler, and yes, he's had a couple of bad films but this one is so bad I believe his career might actually end because of it.

The constant shrieking of Jill is unbearable, and were we really meant to take Sandler's female character seriously? Or was this film only meant to be "funny" because Sandler's in drag? I've still not figured that out, and I don't think I'll devote much more time to doing so.

title","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0810913/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"prescottcandace","dateCreated":"2011-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sandler's Career May Never Recover","reviewBody":"I sincerely wish I could erase this film from my memory. I love Adam Sandler, and yes, he's had a couple of bad films but this one is so bad I believe his career might actually end because of it.

The constant shrieking of Jill is unbearable, and were we really meant to take Sandler's female character seriously? Or was this film only meant to be "funny" because Sandler's in drag? I've still not figured that out, and I don't think I'll devote much more time to doing so.

This film led me to create my IMDb account because if what I've said here can keep even one person from paying to see it then I feel it will have been worth writing.

Cheers.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79640,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.3,"duration":"PT1H31M"</script><metacontent="

Something's wrong." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0187696/","name":"Anatomie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3MDE4NmQtOTM2OS00MmIxLTkzZjYtMmQ5NzFkNmI2NDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004376/","name":"Franka Potente"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0299811/","name":"Benno Fürmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0519756/","name":"Anna Loos"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752328/","name":"Stefan Ruzowitzky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0032932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1141289/","name":"Peter Engelmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752328/","name":"Stefan Ruzowitzky"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Anatomy","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3686138137","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGRhYjUyMzktOTliYi00MDA1LWExNmUtNjUyYmEwY2QyM2VkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGRhYjUyMzktOTliYi00MDA1LWExNmUtNjUyYmEwY2QyM2VkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"datePublished":"2000-02-03","description":"A cute med student starts a summer course at Heidelberg University. David's on her dissection table. She met him the day before on the train. Something's wrong.","keywords":"corpse,morgue,murder,poison,female protagonist","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0187696/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"slayrrr666"},"dateCreated":"2009-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Disappointing, dull and completely overrated","reviewBody":""Anatomy" is a somewhat decent film if not entirely all that great.

**SPOILERS**

Preparing for her studies, Paula Henning, (Franka Potente) is accepted into Heidelberg University with Prof. Grombeck, (Traugott Buhre) in his Anatomy Class, said to be one of the most advanced and prestigious around. Meeting with other students Gretchen, (Anna Loos) and Caspar, (Sebastian Blomberg) in the class, she wonders if her family reputation will affect her chances. When she gets back to her classes, she starts to wonder about the selection of corpses used, and begins to suspect that something isn't right. Investigating the situation, she finds evidence that an illegal practice of outlaw doctors performing unethical experiments is linked to several professors on the campus, and she soon finds herself targeted to keep the secrets hidden, and she races to stop them from doing so.

The Good News: There wasn't a whole lot to this one. One of the best parts to this is the mystery angle that's played up about what the practice is really doing and who's involved, generating some tension to this one later on. The fact that it does this is actually a fun idea, as there's plenty to be crept out at by the rather large amount of time spent among cadavers, which is enough on it's own but here, using the practice is where it really scores a lot of great scenes where she's investigating them. That the look to them is really creepy is another big plus, as the look where they remain intact but are displayed so that the inner workings and organs are visible, often-times while the skin is still attached to the rest of the body, producing a cool and creepy visual. The film does include a little sleaze with it's really fun striptease in the morgue. It works nicely and really gets those elements into the film. The last good plus is the fact that the last half of the film is a full-on traditional slasher movie sequence, complete with a creepy stalking through the library and out into the rest of the campus and is done with a lot of fun times and come really good moments to come along with it. It's one of the better scenes in the film and they're all quite well done, leaving these as the highlights of the film.

The Bad News: There was a couple of really big flaws noticeable for this one. One of the main ones is the complete lack of true horror atmosphere for the film. The idea behind it isn't exactly the greatest one to provide some horror elements, seemingly set-up like a thriller instead with the inclusion of the evil cult and the very way it's handled in here. The fact that it's introduced into the film so very late as it is does account for some flaws, as we're left with the utter dullness of the first half's focus on the special classes and the behavior surrounding them that not a lot of horror-specific elements are presented into the film, but also because it does this, we don't really know a whole lot about the cult to begin. Seemingly, it relies on the notion of being practitioners of illegal experiments to create it's fear of them, since we know nothing about the other than how they work, which can work if they only went into action more often as they don't really do that much anyway. That manages to make the cult hardly involved in the film about them and completely nonthreatening due to their absolute non-appearance and complete cluelessness over what they are actually doing, effectively reducing their fear. The last flaw here is the fact that this one is really dull, as it doesn't have a whole lot of stuff that manages to stick out as being worthwhile for the longest time due to the inclusion of all the other elements mentioned so far make it all the more boring. These here are the film's flaws.

The Final Verdict: Not entirely worthless, but not all that enjoyable either unless you happen to be a fan of these films or like the concept. If either of these apply to you, then this will be highly recommended viewing, otherwise this will most likely be a severe disappointment and should be viewed with caution.

programme.title: Last Night
Last Night – Nur eine Nacht
programme.desc:
Last Night: Directed by Massy Tadjedin. With Keira Knightley, Sam Worthington, Guillaume Canet, Eva Mendes. The story follows a married couple, apart for a night while the husband takes a business trip with a colleague to whom he's attracted. While he's resisting temptation, his wife encounters her past love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1294688/","name":"Last Night","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTk1Nzc5OTkwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjEyMTA4NA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941777/","name":"Sam Worthington"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578949/","name":"Eva Mendes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1127653/","name":"Massy Tadjedin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172053/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0156991/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0084841/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1127653/","name":"Massy Tadjedin"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Last Night -- US Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1543216409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2NjA1NTQ0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjc1MDEzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2NjA1NTQ0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjc1MDEzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"While Michael Reed (Worthington) is an overnight work trip with a colleague to whom he's attracted, his wife Joanna (Knightley) encounters a former lover."},"datePublished":"2011-02-16","description":"The story follows a married couple, apart for a night while the husband takes a business trip with a colleague to whom he's attracted. While he's resisting temptation, his wife encounters her past love.","keywords":"sex with a coworker,business trip,ex boyfriend,co worker,trust","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1294688/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kunago"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"My Number one movie","reviewBody":"This movie is not understandable for everyone. I do believe you need to have some life experience, some relationship experience marriage or long term to understand and feel it.

For me every actor plays their role amazingly. That's what makes movie even more better. You literally feel their emotions.

I have read so many wonderful reviews I just wanted to add that we look at Jo and Alex and we feel love and we think that it would have been wonderful if they end up together. But that's not the reality. It is beautiful and it is so desirable because it is not possible. Once it becomes the reality it will be all ruined.

One question that this movie brings up is about cheating and betrayal. For me Joanna has cheated "more" than Michael. You see Michael realizing straight away that he made a mistake and jumps on the way back but on the other hand you see Joanna fulfilled with emotions and desires but not for Michael but Alex.

Alex is a romantic movie for Joanna, she wants to have it as a perfect dream and every time she has this moment of unhappiness she could think of "what if"

The movie is amazing. My favorite and I definitely recommend to watch it. I believe anyone can relate themselves to at least one of the characters.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47443,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

Based on the novel by Anna Todd." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4126476/","name":"After","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGUwMjk3YzktNDI0Yy00MzFiLWFjNmEtYTA2ODVjMzNhODhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTQ1MDI4MzY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6466214/","name":"Josephine Langford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2842005/","name":"Hero Fiennes Tiffin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9982544/","name":"Khadijha Red Thunder"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1788310/","name":"Jenny Gage"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0698048/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0686442/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0670041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0573185/","name":"Susan McMartin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2309894/","name":"Tamara Chestna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1788310/","name":"Jenny Gage"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi191412761","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJlYWE2NWUtZjJkNC00Y2UzLWI5OTYtNWRlYzg5YjkxYzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJlYWE2NWUtZjJkNC00Y2UzLWI5OTYtNWRlYzg5YjkxYzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dedicated college student falls for a dark and mysterious rebel during her first semester."},"datePublished":"2019-04-12","description":"A young woman falls for a guy with a dark secret and the two embark on a rocky relationship. Based on the novel by Anna Todd.","keywords":"based on novel,one word title,college,teenage girl,teenage boy","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4126476/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ronakkotecha"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"An intense college romance with passion","reviewBody":"After is the kind of film that could have gone horribly wrong. Well, it had all the ingredients - good girl, bad girls, brooding mysterious college hottie, wannabe college teens sporting nose piercings & tattoos, dysfunctional families & broken marriages..the list will go on. But what trumps all of this the heavyduty emotional texture of the film. The intense romance that develops between Tessa and Hardin in a conventional yet very mystical way. There are not many twists and the narrative is simple. However, it hoodwinks you into feeling that something really uncanny will happen - whether or not it does, is for you to find out. Makeout scenes are aplenty but none OTT. They are aesthetic and complimentary to the storytelling. Director Jenny Gage handles that well with his young, good looking actors keeping their next-door image intact. Audience will relate with their characters and root for both of them. Pace is slow but consistent with moments that will stay with you. Overall, AFTER is the kind of college romance everyone hopes for - it's got love, lust and heartbreak in equal measure!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":42873,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="
